content.description: Left Prow of the We-Tall-Dead Turd-All Head. V2+ Start standing, smear feet, use side pull above to pull 4 thin moves to top. V3+ Start right under side pull using compression move off of smear and under clings. Move in to side pull, stay right and throw from letter box, left, to 4 thin moves and top out.
content.protection: Pads, just one, and a spot.
content.location: Teton Canyon Road. Middle to end section. After cattle guard. On the left side of road.

content.description: Start on two good holds move to a good hold directly over head. Match. Go for big move up and right to a good right hand gaston. Move to rail on the lip of the boulder and up and out.
content.location: From the waterfall walk past Waterfall Wall and around the right side of the first large boulder you come across. Continue along the cliff line maybe 1/2 minutes until you see the overhanging boulder.

content.description: Stand up or sit down. Either is difficult. Crux off the ground at the base. Under cling right of dihedral and stem feet on left wall using thin and high foot holds. Muscle through small overhang and pull high feet over corner. Work to right outside of dihedral and pull easier v~1 moves up face using thin flakes. Reach high over top ledge to awkward and airy top out.
content.protection: Multiple pads on hill side. Two or more spotters may be necessary, as this is pushing highball and on small hill side with ankle breakers. Dont let the dangers scare you off this epic problem. It can be protected well and is worth a go.
content.location: At the end of Teton Canyon Drive, head up Table Rock Trail head about 3/4 mile to first waterfall. After small wooden bridge, take a left and hike about 100 yards to boulder field at the base of the waterfall. Necessary Hops is located on the back side (North) of "Slab Lab". Two 16~20 Ft slabby fins, 3ft thick and 3ft apart, 20 ft wide. Necessary Hops is the second most obvious line to the right of the back corner as the base of the boulder starts up hill.
